title: Syria after Assad, a half-festive, half-worried anarchy: 'You won't believe where I am. We're going home!'
summary: While many Syrians are elated to finally be able to return home, many others have begun fleeing the country. In Damascus, residents waver between fear and subdued euphoria.

title: Syria rebel leader discusses 'transfer of power' after Assad's fall
summary: Rebel leader Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, now using his real name Ahmed al-Sharaa, met with Prime Minister Mohammed al-Jalali 'to coordinate a transfer of power that guarantees the provision of services' to Syria's people, said a statement posted on the rebels' Telegram channels.

title: Historian Matthieu Rey: 'Although there is uncertainty in Syria, a sense of joy is making a widespread comeback'
summary: Ravaged by more than 10 years of fighting, the country is getting back on its feet, and faces immense challenges, explains historian Matthieu Rey, in an article for 'Le Monde.'

title: Monitor says more than 100 Israeli air strikes on military sites in Syria
summary: Israel, which borders Syria, has sent troops into a buffer zone on the east of the Israeli-annexed Golan Heights after Assad's fall, in what Foreign Minister Gideon Saar described as a 'limited and temporary step' for 'security reasons.'

title: TikTok is close to being banned in the US. Its last hope: Donald Trump
summary: A US federal appeals court has just rejected the  platform's appeal against a law that would ban it in the country unless it is sold by its Chinese shareholder. The  president-elect, who has been alternatingly pro- and anti-TikTok,  will determine its fate after his inauguration on January 20, 2025.

title: Man arrested over killing of US health insurance CEO being held without bail
summary: Luigi Mangione, 26, was being held by officers in Pennsylvania after being found with a weapon that police described as a 'ghost gun' capable of firing 9MM rounds and equipped with a suppressor. Mangione must now be extradited from Pennsylvania to New York to face murder charges, police said.

title: Dozens of Nobel laureates sign letter opposing RFK Jr. as Trump's health secretary
summary: Among the signatories is Drew Weissman, who received the 2023 Nobel Prize in Medicine for his work on developing mRNA vaccines, which was a major breakthrough in the fight against Covid-19.

title: Kremlin refuses to confirm if Assad is in Russia
summary: Russian state news agencies had reported that ousted Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his family had been given asylum. However, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov declined to confirm these reports.

title: The rise of Abu Mohammed al-Jolani: From jihadist in Iraq to Syria's new strongman
summary: After fighting with Al-Qaeda in Iraq and Syria, the leader of the Islamist armed group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham went on to discipline the Syrian rebels and reassure religious minorities. But his real intentions remain an enigma.

title: Several European countries suspend Syrians' asylum requests
summary: Germany, Sweden, Denmark, and Norway have all frozen decisions on Syrian asylum requests. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and French President Emmanuel Macron on Monday discussed the possibility of cooperating with Syria's new leaders following the ousting of President Bashar al-Assad, the chancellery said.

title: 'Emilia Perez' leads Golden Globe nominations with 10
summary: After winning at Cannes, Jacques Audiard's musical about a Mexican drug lord who transitions to life as a woman is marching toward more prizes in Los Angeles.

title: Director accused of abusing French actress Adèle Haenel goes on trial
summary: Christophe Ruggia is accused of sexually assaulting the actress in the early 2000s when he directed her in her debut film, when she was between 12 and 14 and he was in his 30s.

title: In Georgia, anger spreads beyond the capital: 'We've never seen such a treacherous government!'
summary: More than 40 towns and villages have joined the protest movement against the government, which has suspended the process of joining the European Union until 2028.

title: Finland's President Stubb: Europe must choose between 'Yalta moment and Helsinki moment'
summary: Finnish President Alexander Stubb says in an interview that Vladimir Putin's Russia must pay a price for its war of aggression against Ukraine.

title: In Assad's fall, the US sees validation of its Middle East strategy
summary: Joe Biden hailed the fall of Bashar al-Assad as a 'moment of historic opportunity.' Voices within both the current administration and among those close to President-elect Donald Trump, have hailed the possibility of lasting damage to Iran and its regional proxies.

title: Bashar al-Assad's downfall is a major setback for Russia
summary: The Syrian president has taken refuge in Moscow. In 2015, Kremlin support enabled him to regain control of a large part of the country. This time, the Russian army, concentrating on the Ukrainian front, has hardly intervened against the Islamist rebels.

title: Fall of Assad: In Germany, Austria and Greece, a jubilant Syrian diaspora cautious about a possible return
summary: Around 5,000 people gathered in Berlin to celebrate the fall of the Syrian regime on Sunday, December 8. There were 10,000 people gathered in Vienna and 1,000 in Athens.
